The Triton malware, also known as TRISIS or DistTracker, is a highly sophisticated cyberattack that targeted industrial safety systems, specifically the Triconex Safety Instrumented System (SIS) used in oil and gas production facilities. It was first discovered in 2017 and caused the shutdown of a petrochemical plant in Saudi Arabia, demonstrating the potential for severe physical damage in targeted industries.
